resources.string: This app uses the accessibility permission to simulate the manual gestures used to power off the phone. \nThe accessibility permission is required in order to be able to call the power dialog and then simulate the gestures to turn off the phone. If your android version is at least 13, you may have to check the restricted settings section.
This button will open this tab
This button will reset the position of the draggable items to the center of the screen

This button will call the power dialog so that it is possible to check which action should be performed. This button will not power off the phone, it will just call the power dialog. To power off the phone use the timer in the Timer tab.
These draggable elements can be repositioned around the screen to reproduce the gestures (click(s)/swipe) used to power off the phone

On the Settings tab it is possible to select the type of gestures required to turn off the phone. After selecting the type of gesture (one click, two clicks or a swipe) the user has to drag the draggable circles where the click(s) should be simulated. Click the button to watch a short video about how it works.

In case two clicks are selected the app will simulate first the click of circle one and then the click of circle two, with a delay of 3 seconds between. In case the swipe is selected, the app will simulate a swipe from point one to point two.

On the Timer tab it is possible to set up a timer to power off the phone. It is first necessary to give the accessibility permission and to set up the settings tab for the app to be able to emulate the power off gesture.\nThe timer is in seconds and the spinner on the right will select how many seconds, the spinner on the center how many minutes, the spinner on the left how many hours the timer will wait before powering off the phone. It is also possible to select the specific time for the phone shutdown using the button Select Time.\nThis app should theoretically work even if the screen is off, but that may vary based on the battery optimization, power saving mode, phone model and so on. It is suggested to leave the phone (even locked) on the timer tab after starting the countdown. The power off gestures could require extra time after the set timer if the time while the screen is totally off is more than 5 minutes.
The accessibility permission is required to emulate the power off gesture.\nPlease enable it in the settings.
The accessibility permission is required to emulate the power off gesture.\nPlease enable it in the restricted settings section.
Remember to set in the Settings tab the movement to power off the phone.\nIf you need help consult the Info tab.
This app is totally open-source and you can contribute to its developing or signal any bugs in the github page.
The app requires the accessibility permission to emulate the manual gestures that are used to power off the phone. The permission will not be used for anything else.
